channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly Tip of Corrugated Plastic Roofing / Soil Spoil/ wood, 11th May
item.description:
The location is on the Aggs Hill / Cotswold Way Road in the Passing Place / Field Gate opening on the right hand side going towards the Burnt Oak. The corrugated Plastic has broken up and represents a possible danger to vehicle tyres as some of it was on the road. The other material present was wood and spoil which may contain metal. Please can it be cleared up as soon as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pot hole in cul de sac, 11th May
item.description:
Road outside no.4 lambourne close Gloucestershire
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lambourn Close, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole adjacent to white lines at junction., 11th May
item.description:
Corner Hollis Road/Hollis Gardens (low numbers end). The pothole is long but not wide, as photo, over 40mm deep and could be concerning for cyclists.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Hollis Gardens, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging tree branches. Resident worried about safety in high winds eg a bough breaks., 11th May
item.description:
Miserden Road. Approx between nos 8 -12 .GL51 6__. Please could you do a safety inspection of the overhanging trees in the picture. Resident understands that if work is necessary it will probably need to await end of nesting season!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Miserden Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bollard in pedestrian refuge island has been damaged, 11th May
item.description:
The pedestrian refuge island that sits in the bell-mouth entrance to Bishop's Cleeve Sports Field on Cheltenham Road, GL52 8YF has 2 yellow and white plastic bollards. The 2nd one in appears to have been hit by a car and is damaged exposing the light below and could be a potential trip hazard

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gate broken, footpath blocked & sign missing, 11th May
item.description:
The gate to this footpath is broken, the sign marking the entry to the footpath is missing, and the entry is now overgrown

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4213, Deerhurst, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wait button is stuck on, 10th May
item.description:
The button on one of the posts is stuck in the pressed position. The affected crossing is the puffin crossing on Oriel road (next to Oriel Villas) Because it's stuck, the lights are constantly cycling, even with no pedestrians present
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Wolseley Terrace, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The curb under the railings outside 79–87 Ryeworth Road is broken or missing., 10th May
item.description:
The curb under the railings outside 79–87 Ryeworth Road is broken or missing. Although reported before and the broken slabs were removed, repairs were never completed—only half the job was done. Requesting full repair.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 83, Ryeworth Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 large trees overgrowing, 10th May
item.description:
2 large trees at the back of Woodmancote Vale are overgrown in width and height. They are coming over the back fences of the nearby gardens. Please can them be cut back.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Woodmancote Vale, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ash trees with die back. Look dangerous, 10th May
item.description:
Multiple ash trees have die back between Rising Sun Hotel and Petty Lane. They look unstable and dangerous. Please survey for safety of pedestrians and motorists.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Ash Tree located on Highway land

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evesham Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Elmbridge Court Junction Needs Repainting, 10th May
item.description:
The lines and on road lane indicators across elmbridge Court are terribly worn out. This means that regularly you see cars in the wrong lane making moves at the last minute and there's always crashes on this junction too! Clear indicators on each approach for the lane directions would dramatically help here.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Obstruction on footway, 10th May
item.description:
Obstruction in footway outside number 137 Tennyson Road, this should be within curtilage of their land, not on the footway

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 135, Tennyson Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Obstruction by unpermitted skip, scaffolding, building material on pavement

item.title: Lack of speed limit signs, 10th May
item.description:
This section of the old Evesham road has a 30mph speed limit, indicated by lights. Most drivers seem to think it is a 60mph limit as there are no signs.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Evesham Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues
